intro: Antirrhinum pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Antirrhinum pumilum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
